title: totobola
content:
If I may I’d still take the opportunity and ask about one other font I also asked about previously at WhatTheFont yet it remains unsolved.

I’d thus appreciate your help in identifying it, please, anyone who knows which it is?...

It reminds of [Flux](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/flux/) but the endings in some of the letters are rather different (and also it appears to be somewhat “boldier” than the bold version itself) so I don’t know?... Is it another font all along? (Or would it maybe just be a “customly edited” Flux?...)

Thanks already, once more, for your help and patience.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/totobola_3499.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Mercedes Monster headline - Corporate A {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005033/http:/typophile.com/node/19630 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) La Casa del Consumatore - Adobe Serif MM substitution font {Geoff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005033/http:/typophile.com/node/19718 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sweepi

comments.content:
FF Cocon  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-cocon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-cocon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-cocon/")

\*edit\*  
Sorry, it’s not Cocon
Dax like but heavily modified if so.
